text: as temperatures soar throughout India
people seek shade wherever they can
exhausted by the extreme heat others
cool off in whatever way possible in
Kolkata in the East drivers of the
iconic yellow taxis have been urged by
their unions to stay off the roads
during the hottest hours between 11 a.m.
and 4 p.m.
meanwhile some people were doing their
best to carry on with business as usual
despite warnings to drink plenty of
water and stay indoors so far at least
500 people have died because of the heat
the worst-affected states Andhra Pradesh
and Telangana in the south but across
the country the heat wave is expected to
continue well into the coming week the
heat just builds day on day until we get
some rain and recently we've had 48
degrees in Uttar Pradesh and we're going
to keep these sort of levels for the
next few days it's not just the heat
during the day that's dangerous it's the
heat at night as well it doesn't really
ever weigh at all the next few days and
sees the highest temperatures again
across northern parts of India severe
heat wave warnings across the
northwestern plains but also into erisa
until the monsoon rains bring cooler
temperatures there are fears the heat
wave could yet claim more lives been
bland BBC news
